history.content:
for context I am L&S CS intending to work in industry, nothing crazy fancy

1. is there a harm this semester in P/NPing everything? I think not, but just wanted to make sure that it's fine that we won't have a GPA this semester. if that is the case, what will our transcript show for this term?

2. if I get a NP in a class this semester, and retake it in a future semester for a grade (I don't think I'll get in the class next semester so if I cannot pass it I will take it next year) will the NP still show up on my transcript or will it be replaced by the new grade? will there be an entry for the class in both semesters on my transcript? the class in question is EECS16B if it matters.

3. if I am taking an incomplete this semester and finishing it later, will the grading scheme be determined based on this semester's or a future semester's policies?

4. will it be a problem to have a "missing" semester grade-wise on my transcript? I am not counting out grad school yet but if I do go to grad school it will be after I work in industry for a while (unless the market totally goes to shit or something). I know most companies don't check your transcript and I happily P/NPed one class last semester but kinda afraid to do all of them. (I'm not doing bad in any of them except for one but I just want to take the load off of one tech class so I can focus on passing another, so if I were to explain that to anyone my reasoning looks kinda... bad lol).

5. (edit: another question) how do I actually request the P/NPs? I see I have to fill out some late change of schedule thing that looks like the regular semester's late drop form; am I allowed to fill that out multiple times and keep switching between P/NP <-> GRD until the deadline, or is this a decision I need to make and then fill out the form once and for all? is it like a human going through the requests and fixing them in the system, or does it automatically go through as long as you use the form?

thanks in advance!
history.subject: some questions about P/NPing major reqs
